definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Nearly 400 tons of accumulated refuse and dregs were removed altogether in five days.
sentences.chinese: 五天內清潔工運走了近四百噸堆積的垃圾與渣土。

sentences.english: S7:I'm going to be a cleaner to clean the gyms and take out the trash.
sentences.chinese: 我準備當上一名清潔工，清運垃圾，清掃體育場。

sentences.english: They helped dustmen fix some rubbish bins.
sentences.chinese: 他們幫助清潔工人安裝垃圾桶。

sentences.english: American high-rise washers need specific training in regional standards.
sentences.chinese: 美國高層建築清潔工根據地方標準需要特殊的培訓。

sentences.english: In Tokyo window cleaners dress up as the animals of the Chinese zodiac.
sentences.chinese: 在東京，窗戶清潔工們打扮成了中國十二生肖的模樣。

sentences.english: My father is a cleaner at a local paper mill.
sentences.chinese: 我的父親是本地一家造紙廠的清潔工。

sentences.english: The way most people look at you, you'd think a trashman was a monster.
sentences.chinese: 人們看你的那種神情，就好象清潔工是怪物似的。

sentences.english: What will our world be like without dustmen?
sentences.chinese: 沒有清潔工，我們的世界會變成什麼樣子？

sentences.english: Florence has worked as a cleaner at the factory for five years.
sentences.chinese: 佛羅倫斯在這個工廠做了五年清潔工。

sentences.english: Even a Paris street sweeper is so handsome.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎大街上一個普通的清潔工居然都這麼帥。

sentences.english: As a dustman , she always work very hard.
sentences.chinese: 做爲一個清潔工，她總是很努力工作。

sentences.english: He then changed into overalls and spent the next eight hours as a dustman.
sentences.chinese: 然後他換上工作服，做八小時清潔工。

sentences.english: I used to work as a dustman in NOS.
sentences.chinese: 我在新東方任清潔工一職。

sentences.english: Soon after though, he steals again from a young chimney sweep.
sentences.chinese: 不久後，他又在一個年輕的煙囪清潔工的家中行竊。

sentences.english: Hua sweep to the outside, in those doing the cleaning room.
sentences.chinese: 清潔工阿華來了，在外面的那些房間做着清潔。

definition: to be transferred to another post/to post away
main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
